column5: We love to brag about the cold.....   Like the time we had to build 5 foot fires under the 2000 pound propane tanks ... in order that the propane would still turn to gas from a liquid... (this at -60F).  And most stove oil.. freezes after -40C...
How we BBQ at -40.
LOL Dave.. why I can never figure out why people go with Propane furnaces... tried to tell my kid that. He'll learn the hard way one night!
My furnace is propane. Never had a problem though as it's beside a slight hill. It gets burried by snow early so it's well insulated.

I just returned from Fort McMurray.  -20 & -25 every day, -32 at night, 3' of frost in the ground & 2' of snow  BRRR! Oh yah & we worked every day! Guys are ice fishing in Ft Mac with 4x4 trucks on the ice!  Woo Hoo

With -38 c yesterday and a wind chill of -42 ish u need a little more than a cup of coffee to start the day.......how about a cup of........  hot water  SORRY I CANNOT DOWN LOAD THE VIDEO BUT it is on tv on the weather network today under the force of nature. My wife and I were making some snow.
Now that... is friggin cool. No pun intended
Works down here too. It's just not every week that it's that cold.
Thanks for the help Dave.
I heard It's a dry cold,so you don't feel it as bad!!.
-38??  I knew there was I reason I don't live up north.
Your right, it is much drier than what we had in Barrie. I would happy fish in -35 up here than -10 back in Barrie where we had spent 18 years. Your ice fishing seasons here are guaranteed.
At -38 .....thats the start of our bbq season up here
Thanks for the assist Dave
That's cool!  I remember days like that when I was a kid living in Flin Flon for a few years
Joey we met briefly at fishing for Tylor a few years ago, your welcome to come up and relive the Flin Flon memories. Just bring a couple of steaks.
No problem John.
T'was -48 with the wind this mornin'.
You know what my thermometer says when you throw water up and it powders into ice?  MOVE FURTHER SOUTH.  Thats cold enough to kill a Cajun yaa know    Art
We freak out when the temp drops below 0.   Can't imagine that.  Coldest down here I can recall was -25 F a number of years ago.
Sounds like a good deal to me  I might just have to take you up on that offer
Dang I should let my brother in Saskatchewan know that his -25 was nothing today
At -40C = -40F....  folks generally switch to F. below -40...

Why switch? It's not like C & F are all of a sudden the same below -40  -45C = -49F -50C = -58F -55C = -67F -56.66 = -70F The boiling point of liquid nitrogen -60C = -76F -67.22 = -89F The lowest recorded temp. ever (Snag Yukon a long time ago)

The lowest natural temperature ever recorded on Earth was in 1983 at the Soviet Vostok Station in Antarctica, where it reached  −89.2 °C  or −128.6 °F.  But I hear it didn't feel that cold, because it was a dry cold
Send it down my way Simcoe needs the help.
You have to be there....!
I am here and have experienced temps down to -57C!!! BRRRR!!!
Y'all are all making stuff up everyone knows the universe freezes at - 10F.    Art
